data.title: Mets Morning News: The time zone shuffle begins
data.meta_description: Your Friday morning dose of New York Mets and MLB news, notes, and links.
data.text:
Meet the Mets

The Mets were off yesterday, but they’re set to begin a wild ten-game road trip that will see them play three games in Anaheim, one in St. Louis, three in Denver, and three in Seattle.

Laura Albanese writes that the road trip could shape the rest of the Mets’ season.

Will Sammon and Tim Britton wrote aboute rival teams’ perception of the Mets’ trade deadline.

Anthony Rieber wonders which Mets legend will be the next to have his number retired.

Francisco Lindor is the Mets’ 2024 Heart and Hustle winner.

Around the National League East

The Braves beat the Marlins, gaining a half-game on the Mets in the Wild Card standings in the process.

Around Major League Baseball

Mike Trout suffered another meniscus tear and is done for the season, which ends with just 29 games played—a new single-season low for him as he’s spent far more time on the injured list than on the field since the beginning of the 2021 season.

Sonny Gray was great, but the Cardinals blew a two-run lead in the bottom of the ninth as the Cubs scored three runs for a walk-off win over them.

As you might have noticed when the Mets completed a season sweep of them recently, the Yankees are getting a ton of offense from Juan Soto and Aaron Judge—but not much from everyone else.

With about one-third of the season remaining, here’s what it means to be in first place at this juncture. And here are some updated power rankings following the trade deadline.

Major League Baseball announced its postseason schedule and has included some very sensible flexibility in it.

Trevor Rogers didn’t fare well in his first start with the Orioles as the team was trounced by the Guardians.

The Royals defeated the Tigers rather easily.

In a game featuring two of the teams the Mets will play on this road trip, the Rockies beat the Angels.

Yesterday at Amazin’ Avenue

Lukas Vlahos took a deep dive in grading the Mets’ moves at the trade deadline.

This Date in Mets History
